thread.title: Jermichael Finley, 2 others to be honored at Lufkin Pro Day
thread.title_full: Jermichael Finley, 2 others to be honored at Lufkin Pro Day

title: Jermichael Finley, 2 others to be honored at Lufkin Pro Day
text:
Jermichael Finley, 2 others to be honored at Lufkin Pro Day Posted: Updated: 
From the Lufkin Pro Day Group 
The Lufkin Pro Day Group is preparing once again to honor three outstanding individuals in the sports field from Angelina County. 
Honored this year will be Diboll Lumberjack, University of Texas and Green Bay Packers tight end, Jermichael Finley. Youth baseball coach and trainer, Bud Maddux, coach and teacher at Dunbar and Lufkin High schools, the late Oscar Kennedy, Sr. 
Jermichael Finley participated in multiple sports at Diboll which included football, basketball and track. He was heavily recruited by several Division I schools and chose the University of Texas. After an outstanding college career as a tight end for the Longhorns, he was drafted in the third round of the 2008 NFL Draft (91st pick overall) by the Green Bay Packers and played six years in the NFL with 223 receptions for over 2700 yards and 20 touchdowns. 
Bud Maddux graduated from Lufkin High School and attended college at North Texas and Victoria. With his love for baseball, Bud began coaching in 1974 in the Lufkin Youth Baseball program. Winning his first World Series in 1977, he has been at the helm of 10 champion World Series Teams. Bud still coaches a 12-year old select team, today. He opened the Bud Maddux Baseball/Softball Academy in Lufkin in 2010 where he trains up to 100 students a month. 
The late Oscar Kennedy, Sr. graduated from Wiley College where he played and lettered in football. He began his 49-year teaching career in 1950. He taught and coached at Dunbar and Lufkin High schools. As a coach and educator, Oscar Kennedy offered significant and enduring contributions to the thousands of students and athletes he taught; the number of students that graduated and attended college; number of athletes who played sports in college; and the number of athletes who played in the NFL. He was truly an inspiration to all. 
These three individuals will be honored at the sixth annual Lufkin Pro Day Group Banquet on Thursday, Oct. 22 at 6:30 p.m. at the Lufkin Convention Center. In addition, the 2015 Lufkin Boys 5A State Champion Soccer Team will also be recognized.Tickets to the banquet are $30 and are available from any member of the Lufkin Pro Day Group listed below or may be purchased on the Lufkin Pro Day Group website: www.lufkinprodaygroup.com 
The evening will include recognition of the honorees, dinner and a silent auction. Funds raised from the auction go to the group’s scholarship fund as well as a long range vision for a local museum.Members of the Lufkin Pro Day Group committee are Don Muhlbach, President, Robert Proctor, Vice-President, Martha Olivares Tellez, Treasurer, Paula Metzinger, Secretary, Leon Bagley, E. L. Brown, Gerald Coutee, Joe Houston, Jerry Johnson, Gary Martel, Roy Poole, Calvin Richard, Tina Alexander-Sellers, James Self, Robert Shankle, Barbara Thompson, Kathi White and Stacey Willmann. 
For more information or for tickets, call (936) 633-0205 or visit the group’s website – www.lufkinprodaygroup.com. Can't Find Something?
